title: How to find work you love | Bob Moesta (Jobs-to-be-Done co-creator, author of "Job Moves‚Äù)
key_insights: People hire products to make progress, they don't buy them - focus on the struggling moments that push customers to seek solutions
Context matters more than pain points - understanding the full situation makes seemingly irrational customer behavior rational
Study people who recently made a change rather than those who just want to - actual behavior reveals true motivations
Products typically serve 3-5 different jobs that often conflict with each other - identify and separate these pathways
Interview 10-12 customers maximum in 2 rounds rather than doing massive statistical studies - patterns emerge around 7-8 interviews
Reduce friction (F3 anxiety + F4 habits) rather than just adding features - sometimes raising prices while removing barriers increases sales
Sales processes should match how customers want to buy, not how companies want to sell - meet customers where they are in their journey
Choose what to suck at deliberately - your product trade-offs must align with customer trade-offs

guest_background.current_role: Co-founder and CEO of The Rewired Group

topics_discussed: Customer interview techniques and best practices
Forces of progress model (push, pull, anxiety, habits)
Snickers vs. Milky Way competitive analysis example
Sales process design based on customer buying journey
Differences between various JTBD approaches (Moesta vs. Christensen vs. Ulwick)
Customer churn analysis through JTBD lens
Home building and dining room table story
Career switching patterns and job mobility research
memorable_quotes: People hire products, they don't buy them, they hire them to make progress in their life
Bitchin' ain't switchin' - just because people complain about something doesn't mean they're going to do anything about it
A kick-ass half is better than a half-ass whole
frameworks_mentioned: Six phases of customer journey (first thought, passive looking, active looking, deciding, first use, ongoing use)
summary: Bob Moesta, co-creator of the Jobs-to-be-Done framework, shares practical methodologies for understanding customer behavior through struggling moments rather than traditional market research. The episode provides tactical guidance on customer interviewing, product development, and sales process design based on how customers actually make progress in their lives.
